Welcome to Storyline Online, brought to you by the Screen Actors Guild Foundation. I'm Betty White, and I think we're going to have a good time today! At least I know I am. I'm going to be reading you a book, okay. I love animals, all animals, but maybe dogs in particular. So today, I'm going to be reading you a story about Harry the Dirty Dog. It's by Gene Zion, pictures by Margaret Bloy Graham. Harry was a white dog with black spots who liked everything, except getting a bath. So, one day, when he heard the 
water running in the tub, he took the scrubbing brush... and buried it in the backyard. Then he ran away from home. He played where they were fixing the street and got very dirty. He played at the railroad and got even dirtier. He played tag with other dogs and became dirtier still. He slid down a coal chute and got the dirtiest of all. In fact, he changed from a white dog with black spots to a black dog with white spots. Although there were many other things to do, Harry began to wonder if his family thought that he had really run away. He felt tired and hungry too, so without stopping on the way, he ran back home. When Harry got to his house, he crawled through the fence 
and sat looking at the back door. One of the family looked out and said, "There's a strange dog in the backyard... By the way, has anyone seen Harry?" When Harry heard this, he tried very hard to show them he was Harry. He started to do all his old, clever tricks. He flip-flopped and he flop-flipped. He rolled over and played dead. He danced and he sang. He did these tricks over and over again, but everyone shook their heads and said, "Oh no, it couldn't be Harry." Harry gave up and walked slowly toward the gate, but suddenly he stopped. He ran to a corner of the garden and started to dig furiously. Soon he jumped away from the hole barking short, happy barks. He'd found the scrubbing brush! And carrying it in his mouth, he ran into the house. Up the stairs he dashed, 
with the family following close behind. He jumped into the bathtub and sat up begging, with the scrubbing brush in his mouth, a trick he certainly had never done before. "This little doggy wants a bath!" cried the little girl, and her father said, "Why don't you and your brother give him one?" Harry's bath was the soapiest one he'd ever had. It worked like magic. As soon as the children started to scrub, they began shouting, "Mummy! Daddy! Look, look! Come quick! It's Harry! It's Harry! It's Harry!" they cried. Harry wagged his tail and was very, very happy. His family combed and brushed him lovingly, and he became once again a white dog with black spots. It was wonderful to be home. After dinner, Harry fell asleep in his favorite place, happily dreaming of how much fun it had been getting dirty. He slept so soundly, he didn't even feel the scrubbing brush he'd hidden under his pillow. Did you like that? 
Well you're going to like this even better. This is my friend Ringo. I just met him, but he's a shelter puppy who found a wonderful forever home, so he has a happy ending just as Harry the Dirty Dog had a happy ending. Thank you.

make little or no mention that elderberry should be eaten sparingly so this year I thought I'd put together my own video on elderberries to balance this out in the interest of full disclosure I'd like to discuss some of the benefits associated with eating these berries as well as some things to be careful of based on the research I've conducted most wild food experts agree that elder berries are edible that said it's commonly known that elder berries contain cyanide producing compounds which if ingested in large amounts can lead to unpleasant side effects such as stomach ache and vomiting to the best of my knowledge blue elder berries contain much less of these toxic compounds and are thus more suitable for consumption furthermore the bulk of the cyanide compounds in elder berries are found in their leaves stems and unripe fruits so if you are diligent about how you collect and process your harvest the risk you assume should be minimal for this reason I have come to classify elderberries not as edible but as medicinal for myself and I eat them very sparingly no more than a handful every other day by now you may be thinking why on earth would I eat these berries after hearing that they contain cyanide well elder berries are extremely nutritious they are high in antioxidants vitamins and minerals and they are a great pick-me-up during the cold winter months when store-bought food is expensive and not as fresh the fact that they are slightly toxic is not unique most foods if even with reckless abandon will cause some unpleasant symptoms for example apples cherries almonds and peaches contain trace amounts of cyanide but since we eat these foods and manageable amounts and we have a liver and kidneys to help us eliminate toxins from our bodies most of us will feel no ill effect from eating these foods from time to time in practice I have eaten elderberries many times and felt great it is only when I decided to use them as a staple ingredient in my green smoothies that I experienced my first stomach ache followed by an urge to throw up since then I've learned my lesson and only eat a little bit at a time if I choose to add them to smoothies I do so very sparingly about half a cup or less most of the time however I just eat elderberries in their raw natural form with this video I'm not trying to convince you to eat elderberries my goal is simply to share my own experience and provide you with a more rounded view of the subject that said the first thing you need to do when harvesting elderberries is find some elderberry trees and pick some berries if by this point you still don't know elderberries look like please visit my website sergei valenko comm where you will find a wild edible app that will help you identify them some elder berries are going to be hard to reach for this reason it is helpful to have a ladder or something tall to stand on in this case I use my car with a paddle board on top of it there are two main varieties of elderberries red elderberries and blue elderberries the dark blue variety is much more suitable for food when you eat elderberries make sure they are fully ripe I make an emphasis on the word ripe because as mentioned earlier unripe green elderberries have a higher cyanide content you can upset your stomach but if the fruit is ripe you should have no ill effects how do you know if an elderberry is ripe or not ripe blue elderberries display a whitish dust when they are right they also turn soft as they write them on the other hand unrivalled herb areas can range in color from green to dark blue and they will be hard to the touch it is important to note that one cluster of elderberries can contain both unripe and ripe berries once again look for the whitish dust to be certain another thing to watch out for is eating too many elderberry stems when you collect your berries try to pick up as many stems as possible as they contain the bulk of the toxic elements I watched a great video about elderberry preparation by green bean from eat the weeds calm in this video Dene mentions that if you freeze elderberry clusters ie the branches leaves and everything else the berries come right off the stems I decided to try this and it works like a charm here you can see that the frozen berries come right off the branches enabling me to sift away 99.9 percent of the stems this process is fast and easy from here you can repackage the elderberries in ziplock bags and keep them in your freezer until you are ready to use them there you have it free nutrition for the winter months in summary elder berries are commonly considered as being edible but they can induce some unpleasant reactions if you eat too many of them or if your body is sensitive to them as mentioned earlier I have come to view elderberries more of as a medicinal plant rather than an edible one which means that I eat them very sparingly usually by themselves and I definitely don't indulge in elderberries every day what you choose to do is completely up to you as always I recommend that people approach all new foods with a degree of caution because you don't yet know how this food will affect your body eat it in small doses until you are sure that it Rizza you if you find that a certain food doesn't agree with you please don't force yourself to eat it there are plenty more wild edibles out there that will make you feel joyous and happy and if you follow your body and its cravings you will ensure that you're perfectly safe 100% of the time for more information on wild edibles and common sense foraging guidelines subscribe to this YouTube channel Lu tanco films or visit Sergei boo tanco calm
